quiz.title: Calculus Limits Quiz 5
quiz.subtitle: Limits at Infinity - Intentional Chaos (20 Questions)
quiz.subject: Calculus
quiz.topic: Limits at Infinity - Pedagogical Design Patterns

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{3x^2 - 7x^4 + 2x}{4x^4 + x^3 - 1} \)
questions.explanation: [T↑, S±] Dominant term -7x⁴ hidden in middle. Divide by x⁴: \(\frac{-7 + \frac{3}{x^2} + \frac{2}{x^3}}{4 + \frac{1}{x} - \frac{1}{x^4}}\) → -7/4

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{-2x^3 + 5}{3x^5 - 4x^2} \)
questions.explanation: [Dmix, S±] Numerator degree 3 < denominator degree 5 → 0. Negative infinity doesn't affect degree comparison.

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{8 + x^5 - 3x^2}{2x^5 + 7} \)
questions.explanation: [T↑, C°, Gap] Dominant x⁵ hidden after constant. Divide by x⁵: \(\frac{1 + \frac{8}{x^5} - \frac{3}{x^3}}{2 + \frac{7}{x^5}}\) → 1/2

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{4x^3 - 6x + 1}{-2x^3 + 5x^2} \)
questions.explanation: [S±, Rflip] Equal degrees but negative coefficients. Divide by x³: \(\frac{4 - \frac{6}{x^2} + \frac{1}{x^3}}{-2 + \frac{5}{x}}\) → 4/-2 = -2

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{x^2 + 3x - 7}{5x^4 - 2x + 8} \)
questions.explanation: [Dmix, Gap] Numerator degree 2 < denominator degree 4 → 0. Missing x³ term tests gap recognition.

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{-3x^5 + 2x^2 + 4}{x^3 - 7x} \)
questions.explanation: [Dmix, S±, Rflip] Numerator degree 5 > denominator degree 3. -3x⁵ with x→-∞ gives positive → ∞

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{6x^3 - 4x^4 + 9}{-2x^4 + 3x^2} \)
questions.explanation: [T↑, S±, Frac] Hidden -4x⁴ dominant. Divide by x⁴: \(\frac{-4 + \frac{6}{x} + \frac{9}{x^4}}{-2 + \frac{3}{x^2}}\) → -4/-2 = 2

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{5 - 2x + x^3}{7x^3 + 4x - 1} \)
questions.explanation: [T↑, C°, Rflip] x³ hidden after constants. Divide by x³: \(\frac{1 - \frac{2}{x^2} + \frac{5}{x^3}}{7 + \frac{4}{x^2} - \frac{1}{x^3}}\) → 1/7

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{-x^2 + 3x^4 - 8}{5x^4 - 2x^3} \)
questions.explanation: [T↑, S±] Hidden 3x⁴ dominant despite negative x² upfront. Divide by x⁴: \(\frac{3 - \frac{1}{x^2} - \frac{8}{x^4}}{5 - \frac{2}{x}}\) → 3/5

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{2x^3 - 5x + 1}{-4x^5 + 6x^2} \)
questions.explanation: [Dmix, S±, Rflip] Numerator degree 3 < denominator degree 5 → 0. Negative infinity and signs are distractions.

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{7x^2 - 3x^5 + 4}{2x^5 + x - 9} \)
questions.explanation: [T↑, S±, Frac] Hidden -3x⁵ dominant. Divide by x⁵: \(\frac{-3 + \frac{7}{x^3} + \frac{4}{x^5}}{2 + \frac{1}{x^4} - \frac{9}{x^5}}\) → -3/2

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{-4x + x^4 - 2}{3x^4 - 5x^3} \)
questions.explanation: [T↑, C°, Rflip] x⁴ hidden after -4x. Divide by x⁴: \(\frac{1 - \frac{4}{x^3} - \frac{2}{x^4}}{3 - \frac{5}{x}}\) → 1/3

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{6x^3 - 2x + 8}{-3x^6 + 4x^2 - 1} \)
questions.explanation: [Dmix, S±, Gap] Numerator degree 3 < denominator degree 6 → 0. Missing x⁵, x⁴ terms test gap analysis.

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{x^2 - 5x^4 + 3}{-2x^4 + 7x} \)
questions.explanation: [T↑, S±, Rflip] Hidden -5x⁴ dominant. Divide by x⁴: \(\frac{-5 + \frac{1}{x^2} + \frac{3}{x^4}}{-2 + \frac{7}{x^3}}\) → -5/-2 = 5/2

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{-2x^5 + 3x^3 - 6}{4x^3 + x^2 + 9} \)
questions.explanation: [Dmix, S±] Numerator degree 5 > denominator degree 3. Negative leading coefficient → -∞

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{8 + 2x^3 - x^2}{5x^3 - 3x + 4} \)
questions.explanation: [T↑, C°, Rflip] 2x³ hidden after constant. Divide by x³: \(\frac{2 - \frac{1}{x} + \frac{8}{x^3}}{5 - \frac{3}{x^2} + \frac{4}{x^3}}\) → 2/5

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{3x^4 - 7x + 1}{-6x^4 + 2x^3 - 5} \)
questions.explanation: [S±, Frac, Gap] Equal degrees with negative ratio. Divide by x⁴: \(\frac{3 - \frac{7}{x^3} + \frac{1}{x^4}}{-6 + \frac{2}{x} - \frac{5}{x^4}}\) → 3/-6 = -1/2

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{-x^3 + 4x^5 - 2}{3x^5 - x^2 + 7} \)
questions.explanation: [T↑, S±, Rflip] Hidden 4x⁵ dominant. Divide by x⁵: \(\frac{4 - \frac{1}{x^2} - \frac{2}{x^5}}{3 - \frac{1}{x^3} + \frac{7}{x^5}}\) → 4/3

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{5x^2 - 2x + 9}{-8x^6 + 3x - 1} \)
questions.explanation: [Dmix, S±] Numerator degree 2 < denominator degree 6 → 0. Negative denominator doesn't affect degree comparison.

questions.question: Evaluate \( \lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{6 - 3x^4 + x^2}{2x^4 - 5x^3 + 8} \)
questions.explanation: [T↑, C°, S±, Rflip] Hidden -3x⁴ dominant. Divide by x⁴: \(\frac{-3 + \frac{1}{x^2} + \frac{6}{x^4}}{2 - \frac{5}{x} + \frac{8}{x^4}}\) → -3/2

scoreMessages.90: Exceptional! You see through intentional chaos to the core mathematical structure.
scoreMessages.70: Strong analytical skills! You handle pedagogical misdirection well.
scoreMessages.50: Good foundation! Focus on identifying dominant terms regardless of positioning.
scoreMessages.0: Practice extracting the highest degree term from disordered polynomials systematically.
